name: Guadeloupe
description: Guadeloupe is an overseas region and department of France located in the Caribbean. It’s known for its stunning beaches, lush rainforests, volcanic landscapes, and vibrant culture. The island boasts a diverse ecosystem, rich history, and a unique blend of French and Caribbean influences.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Guadeloupe is a mix of Creole, French, and other European descent.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in the northern plain, while the mountainous interior is sparsely populated.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Guadeloupe is comprised of several islands, including Grande-Terre, Basse-Terre, and several smaller islands.
quickFacts.detail: Grande-Terre is the most populated and developed island, while Basse-Terre is known for its volcanic peaks and rainforests.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Pointe-à-Pitre is the largest city and commercial center of Guadeloupe.
quickFacts.detail: It’s a bustling port city with a vibrant market and historical architecture.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: As part of France, Guadeloupe uses the Euro as its currency.
quickFacts.detail: Credit cards are widely accepted, but it's advisable to have some cash for smaller establishments.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.description: French is the official language, but Creole is widely spoken and understood.
quickFacts.detail: Learning a few basic Creole phrases will greatly enhance your experience.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: Guadeloupe enjoys a tropical climate with consistently warm temperatures and high humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant, particularly during the wet season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is hot and humid, with frequent showers and thunderstorms. It’s the rainy season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn sees a gradual decrease in rainfall and slightly cooler temperatures. The landscape is lush and vibrant.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the driest season, with sunny days and comfortable temperatures. It’s a popular time to visit.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a return of lush greenery and increasing rainfall. Temperatures are pleasant and comfortable.

naturalWonders.name: Piton du Carbet
naturalWonders.description: The Piton du Carbet is the highest point in Guadeloupe and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This iconic volcanic plug dominates the landscape of Basse-Terre.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Formed by a submarine volcano, the Piton du Carbet offers challenging hikes with breathtaking views. Its steep slopes are covered in dense rainforest, home to unique flora and fauna.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before heading out

naturalWonders.name: Grand Ilette
naturalWonders.description: Grand Ilette is a stunning, secluded beach on the island of Grande-Terre, known for its pristine white sand and turquoise waters.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This idyllic beach is surrounded by coral reefs, making it a fantastic spot for snorkeling and diving. It’s a protected area, ensuring its natural beauty remains unspoiled.
viewingTips: Consider a boat trip for access

biodiversityCategory.name: Rainforest Ecosystem
biodiversityCategory.description: Guadeloupe’s rainforests are incredibly diverse, harboring a vast array of plant and animal species, many of which are endemic to the island.

statistics.details: Including numerous endemic orchids, ferns, and trees.
Many colorful tropical birds, including the Sisserou Parrot (endangered).

notableSpecies.name: Sisserou Parrot
notableSpecies.significance: The national bird of Guadeloupe, critically endangered due to habitat loss and poaching.

notableSpecies.name: Guadeloupean Gecko
notableSpecies.significance: A unique gecko species found only in Guadeloupe.

ecosystemData.title: Tropical Rainforest Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: Guadeloupe’s rainforests are a vital part of the Caribbean ecosystem, playing a crucial role in regulating climate and supporting biodiversity. They are characterized by high rainfall, humidity, and a dense canopy of trees.

biodiversityCategories.name: Rainforest Ecosystem
biodiversityCategories.description: The dominant ecosystem, characterized by dense vegetation, high rainfall, and a complex food web.

statistics.details: A diverse range of hardwood and softwood trees.

activities.title: Outdoor Adventures in Guadeloupe
activities.description: Guadeloupe offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and water sports to exploring its rich cultural heritage.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the island’s diverse landscapes on foot, from volcanic peaks to lush rainforests.

activities.name: Piton du Carbet Hike
activities.description: A challenging but rewarding hike to the summit of the Piton du Carbet.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, water, sunscreen, hat

activities.name: La Pointe des Châteaux Hike
activities.description: A scenic hike along the coast with stunning views of the ocean.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters of Guadeloupe with a variety of water sports activities.

activities.name: Snorkeling & Diving
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

activities.name: Windsurfing & Kitesurfing
activities.description: Take advantage of the consistent trade winds.
